intro: Linum gaditanum, commonly known as Spanish flax, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces showy blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often branched. Linum gaditanum is adapted to dry, sunny environments and is often found in coastal areas and rocky soils.
